trans-unit.source: Represents the abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference"></xref>, <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference"></xref> classes derive.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> class.

This constructor initializes a class that is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive.
Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> class using the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).
The `uri` parameter provides information about the location of the data to be encrypted.

This constructor initializes a class that is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive.
Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to the data to encrypt.
The uri parameter is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> class using the specified Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) and transform chain.

This class is an abstract base class used in XML encryption from which the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> classes derive.
Unless you have a scenario where you need to create a custom reference section in XML, use one of the inherited classes.
For more information about XML encryption standards, see http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-encryption-req.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that points to the data to encrypt.
The uri parameter is `null`.
Adds a <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object to the current transform chain of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.Transform"></xref> object to add to the transform chain.
Gets a value that indicates whether the cache is valid.
The cache is used to maintain the encrypted data.
`true` if the cache is valid; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the XML representation of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
You can use this method to output the XML information contained in an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference> object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that represents the values of the `<EncryptedReference>` element in XML encryption.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference.ReferenceType"></xref> property is `null`.
Loads an XML element into an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlElement"></xref> object that represents an XML element.
The value parameter is `null`.
Gets or sets a reference type.

This property is set when using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>, <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.KeyReference>, and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.DataReference> derived classes.
For example, a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference> object sets this property value to <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.CipherReference>.
The reference type of the encrypted data.
Gets or sets the transform chain of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.TransformChain"></xref> object that describes transforms used on the encrypted data.
Gets or sets the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of an <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
Use this property to indicate the location of the encrypted data.
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedReference.Uri"></xref> property was set to `null`.
